data.Sentence: --- lesson 10  The loss of the Titanic

data.Sentence_cn: 巨轮“泰坦尼克”号1912年4月10日从南安普敦起锚驶向纽约。
data.Sentence: The great ship, Titanic, sailed for New York from Southampton on April 10th, 1912.

data.Sentence_cn: 船上载有1,316名乘客与891名船员。
data.Sentence: She was carrying 1,316 passengers and a crew of 891.

data.Sentence_cn: 即便用现代标准来衡量，46,000 吨的“泰坦尼克”号也算得上一艘巨轮了。
data.Sentence: Even by modern standards, the 46,000 ton Titanic was a colossal ship.

data.Sentence_cn: 当时，这艘轮船不仅是造船史上建造的最大的一艘船，
data.Sentence: At that time, however, she was not only the largest ship that had ever been built,

data.Sentence_cn: 而且也被认为是不会沉没的。因为船由16个密封舱组成，
data.Sentence: but was regarded as unsinkable, for she had sixteen watertight compartments.

data.Sentence_cn: 即使有两个舱进水，仍可漂浮在水面上。
data.Sentence: Even if two of these were flooded, she would still be able to float.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，这艘巨轮首航就下沉，造成大批人员死亡。人们将永远记着这艘巨轮的沉没惨剧。
data.Sentence: The tragic sinking of this great liner will always be remembered, for she went down on her first voyage with heavy loss of life.

data.Sentence_cn: “泰坦尼克”起航后的第4天，它正行驶在北大西洋冰冷的海面上。
data.Sentence: Four days after setting out, while the Titanic was sailing across the icy waters of the North Atlantic,

data.Sentence_cn: 突然，瞭望员发现一座冰山。
data.Sentence: a huge iceberg was suddenly spotted by a lookout.

data.Sentence_cn: 警报响过不久，巨轮急转弯，以避免与冰山正面相撞。
data.Sentence: After the alarm had been given, the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision.

data.Sentence_cn: “泰坦尼克”这个弯拐得及时，紧贴着高出海面100英尺的巨大的冰墙擦过去。
data.Sentence: The Titanic turned just in time, narrowly missing the immense wall of ice which rose over 100 feet out of the water beside her.

data.Sentence_cn: 突然，从船舱下部传来一声轻微的颤音，船长走下船舱去查看究竟。
data.Sentence: Suddenly, there was a slight trembling sound from below, and the captain went down to see what had happened.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于这个声音非常轻，没人会想到船身已遭损坏。
data.Sentence: The noise had been so faint that no one thought that the ship had been damaged.

data.Sentence_cn: 在下面，船长惊恐地发现“泰坦尼克”号正在急速下沉，
data.Sentence: Below, the captain realized to his horror that the Titanic was sinking rapidly,
for five of her sixteen watertight compartments had already been flooded!

data.Sentence_cn: 于是，他发出了弃船的命令，几百人跳进了冰冷刺骨的海水里。
data.Sentence: The order to abandon ship was given and hundreds of people plunged into the icy water.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于没有足够的救生艇运载所有乘客，结果，1,500 人丧生。
data.Sentence: As there were not enough lifeboats for everybody, 1,500 lives were lost.
